title: Thank me later
body:
Just came up with an awesome rig on an awesome budget. It should cover all things League of Legends - including playing on max and streaming. All parts can be found on Mwave. Did not account for delivery fees.
 
DeepCool Smarter LED Mini Tower Case - Black $39.99
Intel Core i5 6400 Quad Core LGA 1151 2.7 GHz CPU Processor $245.00 
Gigabyte AMD Radeon RX 460 WindForce OC 4GB Video Card $199.00
MSI H110M GAMING LGA 1151 Micro-ATX Motherboard $99.00
G.SKILL Ripjaws V 8GB (2x4GB) 2400MHz DDR4 Desktop Memory Red F4-2400C15D-8GVR $75.00
WD WD10EZEX 1TB Blue 3.5” 7200RPM SATA3 Hard Drive $68.00
Raidmax Cobra RX-600AE 600W 80+Gold Power Supply $105.00

Total: $830.99

replies.body:
Id swap the raidmax out for a comparable corsair psu or some other reputable brand, in general the psu is the one part you dont want to cheap out on because if it fails it can kill literally every other part in your pc, in other words itd cost you a lot more than the $100 you saved buying the Chinese brand when it fails.

That and raidmax psus have a history of literally exploding and catching fire.

raidmax is a tier 5 psu producer.

heres the tier list guide http://www.xtremesystems.org/forums/showthread.php?108088-Official-XS-Power-Supply-Ranking-Phase-I

on that note you also dont need a 600w supply to power a 460.

that gpu peaks at about 115w and will usually be around the 80-90w mark only going above 100 watts during furmark testing or in peakage.

The rest of your components wouldnt break 200w if they tried so you at most need about 400w

With that in mind this is an alright buy https://www.mwave.com.au/product/corsair-cx430-430w-v3-80-bronze-power-supply-aa49477?gclid=CJDQn9m9ptACFYaYvAodAgMIMw

430w corsair $70 from mwave, only a tier 3 psu but thats miles better than a t5.

Whatta legend. Yeah, just recently got into learning this stuff.

How do you calculate what PSU you need - ah, don't worry. Probably complicated as fuck.

Thanks Brother.

You just take the wattage of all the parts and add it together.

Then give like 10-20% extra just incase it peaks.

hdds and stuff usually use around 5-10 watts at most (probably lower even) and cpus tend to be under 100 watts, so gpu is the main concern when it comes to that kind of stuff.

And dw you just figure that kind of stuff out over time, ive been messing with pcs for about 13 years so i can pull a bunch of pc wisdom out my ass thats really just things i picked up over time.

* Thermaltake Versa H15 M-ATX Tower Case with 450W PSU: $89
* Gigabyte GeForce GTX 1050 OC 2GB Video Card: $189
* Seagate ST1000DM003 1TB BarraCuda Desktop HDD 3.5” 7200RPM SATA3 Hard Drive: $67
* Samsung 750 EVO 120GB 2.5" SATA SSD MZ-750120BW: $75
* G.SKILL Ripjaws V 8GB (2x 4GB) 2133MHz DDR4 Desktop Memory (F4-2133C15D-8GVR): $70.99
* MSI H110M GAMING LGA 1151 Micro-ATX Motherboard: $99.00
* Intel Core i5 6400 Quad Core LGA 1151 2.7 GHz CPU Processor: $245.00

Total: 835.97 (exl delivery) 

For 6 bucks more you get better GPU and Speed with the SSD, chassis and PSU are good quality and are intigrated which saves you money however it  can be replaced.. for a budget PC it should run most games Medium- HIgh maybe pushing to Ultra (havent used a 1050 so cant say but has better performance overall but.... the AMD would bet better RAM wise and will have equal performance)

Edit: Your case is good but the PSU is on the top.. nothing wrong with it however it will be a massive issue later on if you wanna add water cooling or other accessories .. may even cut bits off your motherboard cables such as the CPU Fan ..would worry about that too much more so less room for cable management at the bottom of the Case..

> [{quoted}](name=Third Reich,realm=OCE,application-id=Ntey9fRZ,discussion-id=G06GpLYr,comment-id=0002,timestamp=2016-11-14T05:07:55.052+0000)
>
> That AMD is disgusting.

Dont be a band wagon boy AMD are excellent for the price you pay.. although i do prefer Nvidia because if i build a rig i prefer to go all out and make it proper..

> [{quoted}](name=Gordons Coming,realm=OCE,application-id=Ntey9fRZ,discussion-id=G06GpLYr,comment-id=00020000,timestamp=2016-11-14T06:10:11.257+0000)
>
> Dont be a band wagon boy AMD are excellent for the price you pay.. although i do prefer Nvidia because if i build a rig i prefer to go all out and make it proper..

mfw disliking something makes you a bandwagoner.

mfw AMD is literal trash.

mfw you proved my point.
Not exactly i prefer Nvidia but AMD are not disgusting in one bit .. they're excellent you get the price of a 950 for equivalent of a 970 .. they do overheat but a bargain is a bargain for a build :3
not bad id also chuck in an SSD 120GB for 60 Bucks.. They would help heaps... the ammount of time my games laggy and have to restart.. papa bless <3 20 Seconds
